definition: dagger-axe/abbr. for 戈瑞[ge1 rui4]/(Tw) abbr. for 戈雷[ge1 lei2]
to lay down the pen and take up the sword (idiom)/to join the military (esp. of educated person)
to enlist/to be in the army
the Xirong, an ancient ethnic group of Western China from the Zhou Dynasty onwards/Xionites (Central Asian nomads)

Jung Chang (1952-), British-Chinese writer, name at birth Zhang Erhong 張二鴻|张二鸿[Zhang1 Er4 hong2], author of Wild Swans 野天鵝|野天鹅[Ye3 Tian1 e2] and Mao: The Unknown Story 毛澤東·鮮為人知的故事|毛泽东·鲜为人知的故事[Mao2 Ze2 dong1 · Xian1 wei2 ren2 zhi1 de5 Gu4 shi5]

sentences.english: In the tang dynasty, RongZhou officer with the four fang staple made from a kind of "spring liquor".
sentences.chinese: 在唐代，戎州官坊用四种粮食酿制了一种“春酒”。

sentences.english: County, Rong Guan camp hydrangea dragon is the way down from generation to generation.
sentences.chinese: 清苑县戎官营的绣球龙灯，就是这样代代相传下来。

sentences.english: A nice black broadcloth is what little girls wear.
sentences.chinese: 小女孩该穿黑色的宽戎布料。

sentences.english: This paper proposes a subgrouping of the (Gyal)Rongic branch the light of vowel innovations of the Rongic languages.
sentences.chinese: 本文依据戎语支的元音创新对戎语支语言进行划分。

sentences.english: This paper proposes a subgrouping of the (Gyal)Rongic branch the light of vowel innovations of the Rongic languages.
sentences.chinese: 本文依据戎语支的元音创新对戎语支语言进行划分。

sentences.english: I arranged to pick up Mr. Clarke at the airport and take him to his hotel.
sentences.chinese: 我贩拭戎机场接克推克师少西席，然后带他往宾馆。

definition: the Xirong, an ancient ethnic group of Western China from the Zhou Dynasty onwards/Xionites (Central Asian nomads)
Qiang ethnic group of northwestern Sichuan/surname Qiang
Eastern Barbarians, non-Han tribe living to the east of China c 2200 BC
barley/to moo/to seek or obtain/old variant of 侔[mou2]/old variant of 眸[mou2]

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)/surname Yan
chaste tree or berry (Vitex agnus-castus)/alternative name for the Zhou Dynasty state of Chu 楚國|楚国[Chu3 guo2]
non-Han people, esp. to the East of China/barbarians/to wipe out/to exterminate/to tear down/to raze
prisoner of war/to capture/to take prisoner/(old) northern barbarian/slave
Zhou Dynasty term for a northern nomadic tribe later called the Xiongnu 匈奴[Xiong1 nu2] in the Qin and Han Dynasties
